title: Tex-Mex beef burritos
time: Takes 20 minutes to make, 50 minutes to cook
description: These Tex-Mex burritos with beef, refried beans guacamole and salsa are a perfect way to feed a crowd.
ingredients: A few sprigs of fresh oregano, chopped, or 2 tsp dried
30g grated 100 per cent cacao (we like Willieâ€™s Venezuelan Black, from Waitrose and Ocado)
Guacamole, tomato salsa and lime wedges to serve

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat, then fry the onion for 10 minutes until soft and starting to turn golden. Add the garlic and chillies and cook for 2 minutes. Add the spices and cook for another few minutes.

method.Step 2: Add the mince and season, then increase the heat and cook the meat, stirring, until browned all over.

method.Step 3: Stir in the oregano, passata and cacao, then reduce the heat and simmer for 40-50 minutes (adding a splash of water if it gets too dry) until you have a rich, thick sauce. Stir through the refried beans and cook for 2 minutes more, then season to taste.

method.Step 4: Warm the tortillas briefly in a microwave or char them over a gas flame, then serve with the chilli, guacamole, tomato salsa and lime wedges, allowing everyone to make up their own burritos.
